body:
This has been asked for in other issues and unfortunately is unlikely to happen as per comments in this [blog post](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/powershell-and-openssh-team-investments-for-2022/#powershell-7-in-windows) by @SteveL-MSFT & in this [RFC](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-RFC/pull/324) by @theJasonHelmick 

Therefore I have to mark this issue as closed as `Resolution-Declined` & `Resolution-External` for now until the work from the RFC has been completed which whilst doesn't quite fit the request, it is unfortunately it is currently the best that we can do.
You can install pwsh in many different ways very easily today already, though we do know that this isn't ideal & could be improved but there is a difference in the Support lifecycle of Windows as to that of PowerShell which is no longer easily compatible as they are very different in their support lifecycles which unfortunately ties the PowerShell teams hand for getting PowerShell 7 shipped in Windows and from all the conversations that I've seen it seems unlikely that this will change anytime soon.
